title: The epimutacions User's Guide
text: Epimutations rare alterations methylation pattern specific loci. demonstrated epimutations causative factor genetic diseases. example, epimutations can lead cancers, Lynch syndrome, rare diseases Prader-Willi syndrome, associated common disorders, autism. Nonetheless, standard methods available detect quantify alterations. Two methods epimutations detection methylation microarray data reported: (1) based identifying CpGs outlier values cluster epimutations (Barbosa et al. 2018); (2) define candidate regions bumphunter test statistical significance MANOVA (Aref-Eshghi et al. 2019). However, implementation methods publicly available, approaches compared. developed epimutacions R/Bioconductor package. implemented two methods (called quantile manova, respectively). implemented four additional approaches, using different distribution detect CpG outliers (beta), different model assess region significance (mlm, mahdist, iForest). package epimutacions provides tools raw DNA methylation microarray intensities normalization epimutations identification, visualization annotation. full epimutacions user´s guide available vignette. main function estimate epimutations called epimutations(). name package epimutacions (pronounced ɛ pi mu ta 'sj ons) means epimutations Catalan, language northeast Spain.

title: The epimutacions User's Guide
text: epimutacions package computes genome-wide DNA methylation analysis identify epimutations considered biomarkers case samples suspected genetic disease. function epimutations() infers epimutations case-control design. compares case sample reference panel (healthy individuals). package also includes leave-one-approach (epimutations_one_leave_out()). compares individual methylation profiles single sample (regardless cases controls) samples cohort. epimutacions package includes 6 outlier detection approaches (figure @ref(fig:implementation)): (1) Multivariate Analysis variance (manova), (2) Multivariate Linear Model (mlm), (3) isolation forest (iForest), (4) robust mahalanobis distance (mahdist) (5) quantile (6) beta. approaches manova, mlm, iForest mahdist define candidate regions (differentially methylated regions (DMRs)) using bumphunter method (Jaffe et al. 2012). , DMRs tested identify regions CpGs outliers comparing reference panel. quantile uses sliding window approach individually compare methylation value proband reference panel cluster epimutations.Beta utilizes beta distribution identify outlier CpGs. defined epimutation consecutive window minimum 3 outliers CpGs maximum distance 1kb (Barbosa et al. 2018). Implementation outlier detection method

text: workflow figure @ref(fig:workflow) explains main analysis epimutacions package. package allows two different types inputs: Case samples IDAT files (raw microarray intensities) together RGChannelSet object reference panel. reference panel can supplied user can selected example datasets package provides (section @ref(datasets)). GenomicRatioSet object containing case control samples. normalization (epi_preprocess()) converts raw microarray intensities usable methylation measurement (\(\beta\) values CpG locus level). result, obtain GenomicRatioSet object, can used epimutations() function input. data contain information values CpG sites, phenotype feature data. Allowed data formats, normalization input types

title: The epimutacions User's Guide
text: package contains 3 example datasets adapted Gene Expression Omnibus (GEO): 4 case samples IDAT files (GEO: GSE131350) reference_panel: RGChannelSet class object containing 22 healthy individuals (GEO: GSE127824) methy: GenomicRatioSet object includes 49 controls (GEO: GSE104812) 3 cases (GEO: GSE97362). also included dataset specifying 40,408 candidate regions Illumina 450K array epimutations (see section @ref(candreg)). created epimutacionsData package ExperimentHub. contains reference panel, methy candidate epimutations datasets. package includes IDAT files external data. access datasets need install packages running following commands: , need load package create ExperimentHub object:
code: if (!requireNamespace("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE))     install.packages("BiocManager")  BiocManager::install("ExperimentHub") library(ExperimentHub) eh <- ExperimentHub() query(eh, c("epimutacionsData")) ExperimentHub with 3 records # snapshotDate(): 2022-04-26 # $dataprovider: GEO, Illumina 450k array # $species: Homo sapiens # $rdataclass: RGChannelSet, GenomicRatioSet, GRanges # additional mcols(): taxonomyid, genome, description, #   coordinate_1_based, maintainer, rdatadateadded, preparerclass, tags, #   rdatapath, sourceurl, sourcetype  # retrieve records with, e.g., 'object[["EH6690"]]'              title                      EH6690 | Control and case samples   EH6691 | Reference panel            EH6692 | Candidate epimutations

title: The epimutacions User's Guide
text: IDAT files directory epimutacionsData package: reference panel methy dataset can found EH6691 EH6690 record eh object:
code: baseDir <- system.file("extdata", package = "epimutacionsData") reference_panel <- eh[["EH6691"]] methy <- eh[["EH6690"]]

title: The epimutacions User's Guide
text: Illumina 450K array, probes unequally distributed along genome, limiting number regions can fulfil requirements considered epimutation. Thus, computed dataset containing regions candidates become epimutation. used clustering approach bumphunter define candidate epimutations. defined primary dataset CpGs Illumina 450K array. , run bumphunter selected regions least 3 CpGs maximum distance 1kb . result, found 40,408 candidate epimutations. function epimutation() filters identified epimutations using candidate regions. following code used identify candidate epimutations Illumina 450K array: candidate regions can found EH6692 record eh object:
code: library(minfi) # Regions 450K library("IlluminaHumanMethylation450kanno.ilmn12.hg19")  data(Locations)  ### Select CpGs (names starting by cg) in autosomic chromosomes locs.450 <- subset(Locations, grepl("^cg", rownames(Locations)) & chr %in% paste0("chr", 1:22)) locs.450GR <- makeGRangesFromDataFrame(locs.450,                                         start.field = "pos",                                         end.field = "pos",                                         strand = "*") locs.450GR <- sort(locs.450GR) mat <- matrix(0, nrow = length(locs.450GR), ncol = 2,                dimnames = list(names(locs.450GR), c("A", "B")))  ## Set sample B to all 1 mat[, 2] <- 1  ## Define model matrix pheno <- data.frame(var = c(0, 1)) model <- model.matrix(~ var, pheno)  ## Run bumphunter bumps <- bumphunter(mat, design = model, pos = start(locs.450GR),                      chr = as.character(seqnames(locs.450GR)),                     cutoff = 0.05)$table bumps.fil <- subset(bumps, L >= 3) candRegsGR <- eh[["EH6692"]]

title: The epimutacions User's Guide
text: epi_preprocess() function allows calling 6 preprocessing methods minfi package: normalization approach unique parameters can modified norm_parameters() function: can obtain default settings method invoking function norm_parameters() arguments: However, can modify parameter(s) following example illumina approach: going preprocess IDAT files reference panel (@ref(datasets)). need specify IDAT files directory reference panel RGChannelSet format. result, obtain GenomicRatioSet object containing control case samples:
code: norm_parameters() $illumina $illumina$bg.correct [1] TRUE  $illumina$normalize [1] "controls" "no"        $illumina$reference [1] 1   $quantile $quantile$fixOutliers [1] TRUE  $quantile$removeBadSamples [1] FALSE  $quantile$badSampleCutoff [1] 10.5  $quantile$quantileNormalize [1] TRUE  $quantile$stratified [1] TRUE  $quantile$mergeManifest [1] FALSE  $quantile$sex NULL   $noob $noob$offset [1] 15  $noob$dyeCorr [1] TRUE  $noob$dyeMethod [1] "single"    "reference"   $funnorm $funnorm$nPCs [1] 2  $funnorm$sex NULL  $funnorm$bgCorr [1] TRUE  $funnorm$dyeCorr [1] TRUE  $funnorm$keepCN [1] FALSE parameters <- norm_parameters(illumina = list("bg.correct" = FALSE)) parameters$illumina$bg.correct [1] FALSE GRset <- epi_preprocess(baseDir,                          reference_panel,                          pattern = "SampleSheet.csv")

title: The epimutacions User's Guide
text: function epimutations() includes 6 methods epimutation identification: (1) Multivariate Analysis variance (manova), (2) Multivariate Linear Model (mlm), (3) isolation forest (iForest), (4) robust mahalanobis distance (mahdist) (5) quantile (6) beta. illustrate following examples going use dataset methy (section @ref(methy)). need separate case control samples: can specify chromosome region analyze helps reduce execution time: function epimutations_one_leave_out() compared individual methylation profiles single sample (regardless cases controls) samples cohort. use function need split dataset. ilustrate example going use GRset dataset available epimutacions package:
code: case_samples <- methy[,methy$status == "case"] control_samples <- methy[,methy$status == "control"] epi_mvo <- epimutations(case_samples,                          control_samples,                          method = "manova") #manova (default method) data(GRset) epi_mva_one_leave_out<- epimutations_one_leave_out(GRset)

title: The epimutacions User's Guide
text: annotate_epimutations() function enriches identified epimutations. includes information GENECODE gene names, description regulatory feature provided methylation consortium, location CpG relative CpG island, OMIM accession description number Ensembl region id, coordinates, type tissue: example going visualize different annotations
code: rst_mvo <- annotate_epimutations(epi_mvo) kableExtra::kable(     rst_mvo[ c(27,32) ,c("epi_id", "cpg_ids", "Relation_to_Island")],     row.names = FALSE) %>%    column_spec(1:3, width = "4cm") kableExtra::kable(     rst_mvo[ c(4,8,22) , c("epi_id", "OMIM_ACC", "OMIM_DESC")],     row.names = FALSE ) %>%    column_spec(1:3, width = "4cm") kableExtra::kable(     rst_mvo[ c(1:5), c("epi_id", "ensembl_reg_id", "ensembl_reg_type")],     row.names = FALSE ) %>%    column_spec(1:3, width = "4cm")

title: The epimutacions User's Guide
text: plot_epimutations() function locates epimutations along genome. plots methylation values case sample red, control samples dashed black lines population mean blue:  set argument gene_annot == TRUE plot includes gene annotations:  plot chromatin marks H3K4me3, H3K27me3 H3K27ac need specify argument regulation = TRUE: H3K4me3: commonly associated activation transcription nearby genes. H3K27me3: used epigenetics look inactive genes. H3K27ac: associated higher activation transcription therefore defined active enhancer mark
code: plot_epimutations(as.data.frame(epi_mvo[1,]), methy) p <- plot_epimutations(as.data.frame(epi_mvo[1,]),                         methy = methy,                         genes_annot = TRUE) plot(p) p <- plot_epimutations(as.data.frame(epi_mvo[1,]),                         methy =  methy,                         regulation = TRUE) plot(p)

title: Annotate the DMR resulting from epimutacions package — annotate_cpg
text: data DataFrame-like object. db character string specifying Database use annotation. E.g: 'IlluminaHumanMethylationEPICanno.ilm10b2.hg19'. split character string containing separator CpG ids. Default ','. epi_col CpG ids, row names data base. gene_col column name extract gene names. Default: 'GencodeBasicV12_NAME'. feat_col column name extract CpG feature groups. Default: 'Regulatory_Feature_Group'. relat_col column name extract relation island info. Default: 'Relation_to_Island'. build build bioMart. Default '37'. omim boolean, TRUE annotate OMIMs well. Takes bit longer. Default TRUE.

title: Algorithm AS 204 — AS204
text: c value point distribution evaluated. lambda weights \(\lambda_j\). mult multiplicities \(m_j\). delta non-centrality parameters \(\delta^2_j\). maxit maximum number terms \(K\) (see Details). eps desired level accuracy. mode "mode" > 0 \(\beta=mode\lambda_{min}\), otherwise \(\beta=2/(1/\lambda_{min}+1/\lambda_{max})\).

title: Algorithm AS 204 — AS204
text: function returns probability \(P[X > c] = 1 - P[X < c]\) 204 fault indicator 0 (see Note ), NULL fault indicator 4, 5 9, corresponding faults can corrected increasing "eps". faults raise error.

title: Algorithm AS 204 — AS204
text: Algorithm 204 evaluates expression $$ P [X < c] = P [ \sum_{j=1}^n \lambda_j \chi^2(m_j, \delta^2_j) < c ] $$ \(\lambda_j\) \(c\) positive constants \(\chi^2(m_j, \delta^2_j)\) represents independent \(\chi^2\) random variable \(m_j\) degrees freedom non-centrality parameter \(\delta^2_j\). can approximated truncated series $$ \sum_{k=0}^{K-1} a_k P [\chi^2(m+2k) < c/\beta] $$ \(m = \sum_{j=1}^n m_j\) \(\beta\) arbitrary constant (given argument "mode"). C++ implementation algorithm 204 used identical one employed farebrother method CompQuadForm package, minor modifications.

title: Algorithm AS 204 — AS204
text: algorithm 204 defines following fault indicators: -j) one constraints \(\lambda_j > 0\), \(m_j > 0\) \(\delta^2_j \ge 0\) satisfied. 1) non-fatal underflow \(a_0\). 2) one constraints \(n > 0\), \(c > 0\), \(maxit > 0\) \(eps > 0\) satisfied. 3) current estimate probability < -1. 4) required accuracy obtained \(maxit\) iterations. 5) value returned procedure satisfy \(0 \le P [X < c] \le 1\). 6) density linear form negative. 9) faults 4 5. 10) faults 4 6. 0) otherwise.

title: Algorithm AS 204 — AS204
text: P. Duchesne, P. Lafaye de Micheaux, Computing distribution quadratic forms: comparisons Liu-Tang-Zhang approximation exact methods, Computational Statistics Data Analysis, Vol. 54, (2010), 858-862 Farebrother R.W., Algorithm 204: distribution Positive Linear Combination chi-squared random variables, Journal Royal Statistical Society, Series C (applied Statistics), Vol. 33, . 3 (1984), 332-339

title: Algorithm AS 204 — AS204
text: Diego Garrido-Martín

title: Epimutations analysis based on outlier detection methods — epimutations
text: case_samples GenomicRatioSet object containing case samples. See constructor function GenomicRatioSet, makeGenomicRatioSetFromMatrix. control_panel GenomicRatioSet object containing control panel (control panel). method character string naming outlier detection method used. can set : "manova", "mlm", "iForest", "mahdist", "quantile" "beta". default "manova". information see Details. chr character string containing sequence names analysed. default value NULL. start integer specifying start position. default value NULL. end integer specifying end position. default value NULL. epi_params parameters method. See function epi_parameters. maxGap maximum location gap used bumphunter method. bump_cutoff numeric value estimate genomic profile cutoff negative cutoff used candidate regions. min_cpg integer specifying minimum CpGs number DMR. verbose logical. TRUE additional details procedure provide user. default TRUE.

title: Epimutations analysis based on outlier detection methods — epimutations
text: function returns object class tibble containing outliers regions. results composed following columns: epi_id: systematic name epimutation identified. provides name used anomaly detection method. sample: name sample containing epimutation. chromosome, start end: indicate location epimutation. sz: window's size event. cpg_n: number CpGs epimutation. cpg_ids: names CpGs epimutation. outlier_score: method manova provides approximation F-test Pillai score, separated /. method mlm provides approximation F-test R2 model, separated /. method iForest provides magnitude outlier score. method beta provides mean outlier p-value. methods quantile mahdist filled NA. outlier_direction: indicates direction outlier "hypomethylation" "hypermethylation" manova, mlm, iForest, mahdist computed values obtained bumphunter. quantile computed location sample reference distribution (left vs. right outlier). method beta return NA. pvalue: methods manova, mlm, iForest provides p-value obtained model. method quantile, mahdist beta filled NA. adj_pvalue: methods p-value (manova mlm adjusted p-value Benjamini-Hochberg based total number regions detected Bumphunter. epi_region_id: Name epimutation region defined candRegsGR. CRE: cREs (cis-Regulatory Elements) defined ENCODE overlapping epimutation region. Different cREs separated ;. CRE_type: Type cREs (cis-Regulatory Elements) defined ENCODE. Different type separeted , different cREs separated ;.

title: Epimutations analysis based on outlier detection methods — epimutations
text: function compares case sample control panel identify epimutations given sample. First, DMRs identified using bumphunter approach. , CpGs DMRs tested order detect regions CpGs outliers. , different outlier detection methods can selected: Multivariate Analysis Variance ("manova"). manova Multivariate Linear Model ("mlm") Isolation Forest ("iForest") isolation.forest Robust Mahalanobis Distance ("mahdist") covMcd Quantile distribution ("quantile") Beta ("beta") defined candidate epimutation regions (found candRegsGR) based 450K array design. CpGs equally distributed along genome, CpGs closer CpGs can form epimutation. information can found candRegsGR documentation.

what: Identifies epimutations based on a beta distribution. — epi_beta
title: Identifies epimutations based on a beta distribution. — epi_beta
text: epi_beta method models DNA methylation data using beta distribution. First, beta distribution parameters reference population precomputed passed method. , compute probability observing methylation values case reference beta distribution. CpGs p-values smaller threshold pvalue_threshold methylation difference mean reference methylation higher diff_threshold defined outlier CpGs. Finally, epimutations defined group contiguous outlier CpGs.

title:

and epimutations_one_leave_out functions — epi_parameters
text: manova, mlm, iForest, mahdist, quantile, beta method selected function epimutations. pvalue_cutoff threshold p value select CpG regions outliers manova, mlm beta methods. outlier_score_cutoff outlier score threshold identify outliers CpGs isolation forest (iForest) method. Default 0.5. ntrees number binary trees build model build isolation forest (iForest) method. Default 100. nsamp number subsets used initial estimates Minimum Covariance Determinant used compute Robust Mahalanobis distance (mahdist). can set : "best", "exact", "deterministic". nsamp = "best" exhaustive enumeration done, long number trials exceed 100'000. nsamp = "exact" exhaustive enumeration attempted however many samples needed. case, warning message may displayed saying computation can take long time. nsamp = "deterministic". information see covMcd. Default "deterministic". window_sz maximum distance CpGs considered DMR. parameter used quantile (default: 1000). qsup, qinf, offset_abs upper lower quantiles (threshold) consider CpG outlier using quantile method, well offset consider (defaults: 0.005, 0.995, 0.15). diff_threshold Minimum methylation difference CpG mean methylation consider position outlier.

title: Non-parametric, Asymptotic P-values for Multivariate Linear Models — mlm
text: formula object class "formula" (one can coerced class): symbolic description model fitted. data optional data frame, list environment (object coercible .data.frame data frame) containing variables model. found data, variables taken environment(formula), typically environment mlm called. transform transformation response variables: "none", "sqrt" "log". Default "none". contrasts optional list. See contrasts.arg model.matrix.default. Default "contr.sum" ordered factors "contr.poly" unordered factors. Note different default setting options("contrasts"). subset subset predictors summary statistics reported. Note different "subset" argument lm. fit logical. TRUE multivariate fit transformed centered responses returned.

title: Non-parametric, Asymptotic P-values for Multivariate Linear Models — mlm
text: mlm returns object class  "MLM", list containing: call matched call. aov.tab ANOVA table Df, Sum Sq, Mean Sq, F values, partial R-squared P-values. precision precision P-value computation. transform transformation applied response variables. na.omit incomplete cases removed (see na.omit). fit fit = TRUE multivariate fit done transformed centered response variables also returned.

title: Non-parametric, Asymptotic P-values for Multivariate Linear Models — mlm
text: Y matrix obtained transforming (optionally) centering original response variables. , multivariate fit obtained lm can used compute sums squares, pseudo-F statistics asymptotic P-values terms specified formula non-parametric manner.

title: Settings for parameters of epi_preprocess function — norm_parameters
code: norm_parameters(   illumina = list(bg.correct = TRUE, normalize = c("controls", "no"), reference = 1),   quantile = list(fixOutliers = TRUE, removeBadSamples = FALSE, badSampleCutoff = 10.5,     quantileNormalize = TRUE, stratified = TRUE, mergeManifest = FALSE, sex = NULL),   noob = list(offset = 15, dyeCorr = TRUE, dyeMethod = c("single", "reference")),   funnorm = list(nPCs = 2, sex = NULL, bgCorr = TRUE, dyeCorr = TRUE, keepCN = FALSE) )

title: Settings for parameters of epi_preprocess function — norm_parameters
text: illumina, quantile, noob, funnorm preprocess method selected function epi_preprocess. bg.correct logical. TRUE background correction performed "illumina" method. Default TRUE. normalize logical. TRUE control normalization performed "illumina" method. reference numeric. reference array control normalization "illumina" method. fixOutliers logical. TRUE low outlier Meth Unmeth signals fixed "quantile" method. Default TRUE. removeBadSamples logical. TRUE bad samples removed. badSampleCutoff numeric specifying cutoff label samples 'bad' "quantile" method. Default 10.5. quantileNormalize logical. TRUE quantile normalization performed "quantile" method. Default TRUE. stratified logical. TRUE quantile normalization performed within region strata "quantile" method. Default TRUE. mergeManifest logical. TRUE information associated manifest package merged output object "quantile" method. Default FALSE. offset numeric specifying offset normexp background correction "noob" method. Default 15. dyeCorr logial. Dye correction done "noob" "funnorm" methods. Default TRUE. dyeMethod specify dye bias correction done, single sample approach reference array "noob" method. nPCs numeric specifying number principal components control probes PCA "funnorm" method. Default 2. sex optional numeric vector containing sex samples "quantile" "funnorm" methods. bgCorr logical. TRUE NOOB background correction done prior functional normalization. "funnorm" method. Default TRUE. keepCN logical. TRUE copy number estimates kept "funnorm" method. Default FALSE.

title: Settings for parameters of epi_preprocess function — norm_parameters
text: function returns list set parameters normalization method used epi_peprocess.
